title: #ProfileforPeace: New initiative to bring India and Pakistan together?
text:
#ProfileforPeace: New initiative to bring India and Pakistan together? By Rutu Ladage on October 23, 2015 at 8:45 PM Comments 
We were not two nations but a part of one beautiful big country once. But then, we were torn apart. And hatred seeped in. India and Pakistan have been at loggerheads since ages. Despite what the people of the two nations want (except during cricket matches of course), many political parties and other social groups are hell bent on ruining the brotherhood between them. People of India and Pakistan both want peace. They both appreciate each other’s cultures and diversities. They know they are different and yet very similar. Just being across the border does not make them an enemy or evil. 
Many Indians have Pakistani friends and vice versa but clearly, political parties are beyond understanding the nuances of such relationships. And it is at such times when the nations do not need more hatred but acceptance that one man from Mumbai stepped up and decided to make a difference. He did something very simple. used Facebook. We use social media for multiple causes and if this is what it takes to reach out to our anti-tolerant politicos then so be it. 
[Read More: Here’s why the next terror attack in Mumbai is a child’s play for terrorists ] 
Mumbaikar Ram Subramanian started a simple Facebook hastag: #ProfileforPeace. he did not move mountains. Just took a post it and wrote that he does not hate Pakistan or Pakistanis. His simple step moved millions into joining him and changing their profile pictures and proclaiming their love for the neighbours. He put up the photo as his profile picture with this text: 
This is the idea. Do join in if you believe in peace being the way forward. write this message on a post it note, take a selfie and make it your profile picture #ProfileForPeace No more artists being banned. This is my voice. This is our voice for our Mumbai, our India. Enough of hate politics. #SpeakUp
